div.p: How a conformance statement is intended to be used.
This code system http://hl7.org/fhir/conformance-statement-kind defines the following codes:

tr.td: The Conformance instance represents the present capabilities of a specific system instance. This is the kind returned by OPTIONS for a FHIR server end-point.
The Conformance instance represents the capabilities of a system or piece of software, independent of a particular installation.
Elements marked as 'optional' represent configurable capabilities
The Conformance instance represents a set of requirements for other systems to meet; e.g. as part of an implementation guide or 'request for proposal'.
